name: Kepler-5
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-5 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Kepler-5 is a star with 1.37 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.79 times its radius. It is located 3011.76 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-5 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Kepler-5 system


Kepler-5 b

Kepler-5 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-5 b is 671.2980000000001 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-5 b is 15.984 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, Kepler-5 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-5, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
